fields.invitationTextSubject: Welcome to an experiment in economics at ESI.
fields.invitationText:
[subject name],

Welcome to an experiment in economics.

The experiments starts on:
[start date]

The experiment lasts for:
[number of days] days, ending on [end date]

Use the this link to log in:
[log in link]

Keep this email, you need to follow this link to log in each day.

Do not share this link with others.

If you have trouble logging, do not reply to this email, please contact:
[contact email]

Thanks for your participation!
fields.cancelationText:
[subject name],

Unfortunately we had to cancel the online Fitbit experiment you have been participating in.

No further action is required on your part.

If you have any questions, do not reply to this email, please contact:
[contact email]

Thank you for your understanding.
fields.consentForm:
Informed Consent to Participate as a Human Subject in Social/Behavioral Research
Chapman University
One University Dr.
Orange, CA 92866

You are being invited to participate in a research study. Participation in this study is completely
voluntary. Please read the information below and ask questions about anything that you do not
understand. 

STUDY LOCATION:
Economic Science Institute, Wilkinson Hall, Chapman University or Online

RESEARCH PROCEDURES:
This research is being conducted to study the economics of decision-making. Unless otherwise notified, this experiment will last up to 120 minutes. You will be invited to participate online or in person. In addition to the minimum of $7 for showing up on time and participating, you will be paid based upon your decisions and the decisions of others who are in the experiment. You are free to ask any questions about how you will be paid. Any earnings beyond your $7 for showing up on time can only be paid upon completion of the experiment. Earnings and your show up fee for online experiments will be paid electronically upon completion of the experiment. If you agree to participate you will be asked to make decisions at a terminal in a computer laboratory or online on your own computer.

RISKS:
As with any study involving collection of data, there is the possibility of breach of confidentiality of data. Every precaution will be taken to secure participantsâ€™ personal information to ensure confidentiality.
If collecting IP addresses or mac information, participants will be notified ahead of time. Use of such
information would only be temporarily stored to aid with any technical difficulties should they arise.

BENEFITS:
There are no direct personal benefits for participation.

PARTICIPATION:
You must be 18 or over to participate. Your participation is voluntary, and you may withdraw from the
study at any time and for any reason. There are no costs to you or any other party. There are also no
effects of participating or not participating in this study on your grade.

CONFIDENTIALITY:
All electronic files will be saved confidentially on the ESI password-protected and access-restricted local area network. No person-identifiable information will be reported in any published or unpublished work. The data is protected in the local area network as secured by the Chapman University login procedures. Access is restricted to the professors and trained graduate students associated with the Economic Science Institute. Person-identifiable information will be securely stored and deleted when deemed necessary. Non-person identifiable data may be made publicly available.

FOR QUESTIONS RELATED TO THE STUDY OR TO REPORT A CONCERN:
This study is being conducted by researchers of the Economic Science Institute at Chapman University. For questions or complaints please contact Megan Luetje at 714/628-2848. Megan will put you in direct contact with the Principal Investigator of the research project you participated in. If you have additional questions or concerns about the study or the informed consent process you may write or call the Office of Research and Sponsored Programs Administration/IRB Administrator, Chapman University, One University Drive, Orange, CA 92866; Telephone (714) 628-7392. This project has been reviewed according to Chapman University procedures governing your participation in this research.

I have read the above information, understand it fully and have had any questions regarding the
study answered to my satisfaction. I consent to participate in the research.

I agree to participate in the study


Chapman University
0910H017
Approved on 7-16-2020
Expires on 7-15-2021

fields.heartHelpText:
Connect fitbit
If you see "Connect fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Active Minutes" you need to connect your fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect fitbit" link and enter your fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We will only be collecting the number of minutes you sleep and the number of minutes you exercise. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Heart Health Score
Your heart health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more exercise your fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day. The higher your score, the more you will be paid.

Maintenance Minutes
These are number of exercise minutes your fitbit must record today to keep your heart health score same tomorrow.

Improvement Minutes
These are number of exercise minutes your fitbit must record today to improve your heart health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of exercise minutes your fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your heart score will change tomorrow based on the amount of exercise you do today. Notice that doing a little bit more exercise today might increase your heart score by a little, or at certain exercise levels, it might increase it by a lot.
fields.immuneHelpText:
Connect fitbit
If you see "Connect fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Active Minutes" you need to connect your fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect fitbit" link and enter your fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We will only be collecting the number of minutes you sleep and the number of minutes you exercise. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Sleep Health Score
Your sleep health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more sleep your fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day. The higher your score, the more you will be paid.

Maintenance Hours
These are number of hours of sleep your fitbit must record today to keep your sleep health score same tomorrow.

Improvement Hours
These are number of hours of sleep your fitbit must record today to improve your sleep health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of sleep hours your fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your sleep score will change tomorrow based on the amount of sleep you get today. Notice that getting a little bit more sleep today might increase your sleep score by a little, or at certain sleep levels, it might increase it by a lot.
fields.paymentHelpText:
Daily Payment
Your daily payment is based on three components.:
  • The fixed payment is the amount of money you receive for checking in every day. This component is not affected by your exercise or sleep activity.
  • Heart pay is the amount of money you receive for doing daily exercise. For each heart point in your heart score you will earn a heart payment. Your heart score cannot exceed 100.
  • Sleep pay is the amount of money you receive for sleeping each day. For each sleep point in your heart score you will earn a heart payment. Your sleep score cannot exceed 100.

Notes
  • You must visit the site each day and verify that your activity minutes match what your fitbit app shows for yesterday. Press the refresh button in the top right if site still shows yesterday's date.
  • You must press the Pay Me button to get paid each day, payments are sent via PayPal to your email address.
  • You will only be paid for activates recorded by the fitbit tracker. Manually added activities will be ignored. It is your responsibility to make sure the fitbit is recording accurately. We cannot pay you for activities the fitbit tracker does not register.
fields.manualHelpText:
Parameters

  • Import: Copy these parameters from another session into this one.
  • Activity: The formula for converting fitbit effort into activity points.  Activity T1 is the seed value for period one.  The activity value ranges from zero to one.
  • Earnings:  There are three components, a fixed payment per day along with a heart payment and immune payment.  The heart and immune payment have a max payment multiplied by the associated activity points.
  • Time Blocks: There can be up to three blocks each lasting some number of days.  Each block can specify different fixed, heart and immune payment.  Each block can last a different number of days.  Unused blocks should be set to zero.
  • Graph: The display parameters used to display the graphs to subjects.

Session

  • Title: Give the session a meaningful name.
  • Treatment:
    • Individual: Subject does experiment alone.
    • Individual with chat: Subject does the experiment but can chat with others and see their current status.
    • Individual with chat and bonus: Same as above but if group meets activity targets, they get an earnings bonus.
  • Start / End Date: The day the experiment starts and ends based on time blocks setup in the parameters.  Period one does not count towards the first time block.

Control

  • Start Session: Once the parameters have been set and the subjects have been added, start the session. This can be done before the start date.
  • Cancel Session: Send a cancelation email to the subject and stop the session. Subjects will no longer be able to take actions.
  • Send Invitations: Send an email to all the subjects with their log in link. This can also be used to send a general announcement.
  • Download Data: Download a CSV with the data tables, including the parameters that were used.

Subjects

  • Add Subject: Add a new subject to the session.
  • Delete: Remove subject from the session.
  • fitbit check: Check the fitbit connection status for each of the subjects.
  • fitbit setup: Attach fitbit to subject account, must a subject’s fitbit account username and password.
  • Edit:
    • Full Name: Subject’s first and last name.
    • Contact Email: Email PayPal emails will be sent to.
    • Student ID: Chapman ID number used to upload payments to recruiter.
    • Gmail Address: Email address used to fitbit login.
    • Gmail Password: Password for Gmail account used for fitbit account.

fields.paymentHelpTextBaseline:
Daily Payment
  • You receive a fixed payment for checking in every day. This is not affected by your exercise or sleep activity. If you fail to check-in on any given day you will not be paid for that day.

Notes
  • You must visit the site each day and verify that your activity minutes match what your fitbit app shows for yesterday. Press the refresh button in the top right if site still shows yesterday's date.
  • You must press the Pay Me button to get paid each day, payments are sent via PayPal to your email address.
fields.manualHelpText:
Parameters

  • Import: Copy these parameters from another session into this one.
  • Activity: The formula for converting fitbit effort into activity points.  Activity T1 is the seed value for period one.  The activity value ranges from zero to one.
  • Earnings:  There are three components, a fixed payment per day along with a heart payment and immune payment.  The heart and immune payment have a max payment multiplied by the associated activity points.
  • Time Blocks: There can be up to three blocks each lasting some number of days.  Each block can specify different fixed, heart and immune payment.  Each block can last a different number of days.  Unused blocks should be set to zero.
  • Graph: The display parameters used to display the graphs to subjects.

Session

  • Title: Give the session a meaningful name.
  • Treatment:
    • Baseline: Subject receives only fixed payment per day.
    • Individual: Subject does experiment alone.
    • Individual with chat: Subject does the experiment but can chat with others and see their current status.
    • Individual with chat and bonus: Same as above but if group meets activity targets, they get an earnings bonus.
  • Start / End Date: The day the experiment starts and ends based on time blocks setup in the parameters.  Period one does not count towards the first time block.

Control

  • Start Session: Once the parameters have been set and the subjects have been added, start the session. This can be done before the start date.
  • Cancel Session: Send a cancelation email to the subject and stop the session. Subjects will no longer be able to take actions.
  • Send Invitations: Send an email to all the subjects with their log in link. This can also be used to send a general announcement.
  • Download Data: Download a CSV with the data tables, including the parameters that were used.
  • Download Earnings: Download a CSV for the specified date in a Recruiter uploadable format.

Subjects

  • Add Subject: Add a new subject to the session.
  • Delete: Remove subject from the session.
  • Check fitbit: Check the fitbit connection status for each of the subjects.
  • Login Link: Press button to copy link to clipboard.
  • fitbit setup: Attach fitbit to subject account, must have a subject’s fitbit account username and password.
  • Edit:
    • Full Name: Subject’s first and last name.
    • Contact Email: Email PayPal emails will be sent to.
    • Student ID: Chapman ID number used to upload payments to recruiter.
    • Gmail Address: Email address used to fitbit login.
    • Gmail Password: Password for Gmail account used for fitbit account.
fields.staffHomeHelpText:
Create Sessin: Create a new sessin, session will be titled "*** New Session ***" and have a start date of today.

Title: Give the session a recognizable name.

Date: Date range the experiment will take place on.

Current Period: Shows the current period, note that period 1 is a setup period, time blocks start on period 2. The "---" symbol means that either the experiment has not started yet or is over.

Control Deleting a session will remove all of its data, be careful!
fields.blockChangeText:
You will now earn $[heart pay] for each exercise point you have.

You will now earn $[immune pay] for each sleep point you have.

You will continue to earn $[fixed pay] for checking in each day.
